intro: Croton praetervisus, commonly known as the false croton, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and diverse leaf structures. The plant features alternate, palmate leaves with a vibrant green color and prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Croton praetervisus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage.
